title: Calculate SHAP values on distributed xgboost
body:
Hi Scott,

I'm interested in learning more about SHAP and using SHAP values for my project. I read through your example here (https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/tests/explainers/test_tree.py), especially how you extract shap values at these lines:

`  # train XGBoost model
    X, y = shap.datasets.boston()
    model = xgboost.train({"learning_rate": 0.01}, xgboost.DMatrix(X, label=y), 100)

    # explain the model's predictions using SHAP values
    explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
    shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)

    # visualize the first prediction's explaination
    shap.force_plot(explainer.expected_value, shap_values[0, :], X.iloc[0, :])`

In my case, I run XGBoost in a distributed way. After the training is done, we got the model binary. It is hard for us to get the X matrix and put it in the explainer (as in explainer.shap_values(X)). Do you have a plan to export the shap values directly from the xgboost (such that after the distributed training is done, we can easily extract the shap values)?

Thank you
Tien
